errors.startGtEnd: Start time must be less than end time
errors.startSecondsTooLong: Start seconds must be less than 60
errors.endSecondsTooLong: End seconds must be less than 60

lowpass.name: Lowpass
lowpass.description: A low-pass filter is a filter that passes signals with a frequency lower than a certain cutoff frequency and attenuates signals with frequencies higher than the cutoff frequency.

highpass.name: Highpass
highpass.description: A high-pass filter is a filter that passes signals with a frequency higher than a certain cutoff frequency and attenuates signals with frequencies lower than the cutoff frequency.

reverb.name: Reverb
reverb.description: Reverb is the persistence of sound after the sound is produced. A reverberation, or reverb, is created when a sound or signal is reflected causing a large number of reflections to build up and then decay as the sound is absorbed by the surfaces of objects in the space – which could include furniture, people, and air.

delay.name: Delay
delay.description: Delay is an audio effect which records an input signal to an audio storage medium, and then plays it back after a period of time. The delayed signal may either be played back multiple times, or played back into the recording again, to create the sound of a repeating, decaying echo.

compressor.name: Compressor
compressor.description: A compressor is an audio signal processing unit that reduces the dynamic range of an audio signal. This is done by bringing down the level of the loudest parts of the signal while leaving the quieter parts untouched.

bandpass.name: Bandpass
bandpass.description: A band-pass filter is a device that passes frequencies within a certain range and rejects (attenuates) frequencies outside that range.

chorus.name: Chorus
chorus.description: Chorus is an audio effect that takes a single audio input and mixes it with one or more delayed, pitch-modulated copies of the original signal. The pitch of the added voices is typically modulated by an LFO.

phaser.name: Phaser
phaser.description: A phaser is an electronic sound processor used to filter a signal by creating a series of peaks and troughs in the frequency spectrum.

highShelfFilter.name: Highshelf filter
highShelfFilter.description: A high-shelf filter is a filter that passes signals with a frequency higher than a certain cutoff frequency and attenuates signals with frequencies lower than the cutoff frequency.

lowShelfFilter.name: Lowshelf filter
lowShelfFilter.description: A low-shelf filter is a filter that passes signals with a frequency lower than a certain cutoff frequency and attenuates signals with frequencies higher than the cutoff frequency.

peakFilter.name: Peak filter
peakFilter.description: A peak filter is a filter that passes signals with a frequency higher or lower than a certain cutoff frequency and attenuates signals with frequencies around the cutoff frequency.

distantSource.name: Distant source
distantSource.description: Distant source effect is a sound effect that makes the sound source appear to be further away from the listener.

distantSourceEnhancedReverb.name: Distant source enhanced reverb
distantSourceEnhancedReverb.description: Distant source enhanced reverb effect is a sound effect that makes the sound source appear to be further away from the listener with enhanced reverb.

closeSource.name: Close source
closeSource.description: Close source effect is a sound effect that makes the sound source appear to be closer to the listener.

distantAlteredSource.name: Distant altered source
distantAlteredSource.description: Distant altered source effect is a sound effect that makes the sound source appear to be further away from the listener with altered sound.

stereoSpread.name: Stereo spread
stereoSpread.description: Stereo spread effect is a sound effect that makes the sound source appear to be wider.

enhancedStereoSpread.name: Enhanced stereo spread
enhancedStereoSpread.description: Enhanced stereo spread effect is a sound effect that makes the sound source appear to be wider with enhanced sound.

expansiveStereoSpread.name: Expansive stereo spread
expansiveStereoSpread.description: Expansive stereo spread effect is a sound effect that makes the sound source appear to be wider with expansive sound.

brightSpread.name: Bright spread
brightSpread.description: Bright spread effect is a sound effect that makes the sound source appear to be wider with bright sound.

brightReverbSpread.name: Bright reverb spread
brightReverbSpread.description: Bright reverb spread effect is a sound effect that makes the sound source appear to be wider with bright sound and reverb.

phasedBrightness.name: Phased brightness
phasedBrightness.description: Phased brightness effect is a sound effect that makes the sound source appear to be brighter with phased sound.

echoedPhasedBrightness.name: Echoed phased brightness
echoedPhasedBrightness.description: Echoed phased brightness effect is a sound effect that makes the sound source appear to be brighter with echoed phased sound.

dynamicPhasedEcho.name: Dynamic phased echo
dynamicPhasedEcho.description: Dynamic phased echo effect is a sound effect that makes the sound source appear to be brighter with dynamic phased echo.

distantSourceAlternate.name: Distant source alternate
distantSourceAlternate.description: Distant source alternate v1 effect is a sound effect that makes the sound source appear to be further away from the listener with alternate sound.

effectStates.noComplex: No parameters available for this complex effect.
